content:
I will call the `Protocol` agent to modify the current best procedure.
My reasoning for choosing this agent is to apply the new time-saving hypothesis to the existing, best-performing experimental protocol. The `Hypothesis` agent just suggested reducing the coupling reaction incubation time, and the `Protocol` agent is the correct tool to incorporate this change into the detailed procedure.

I will set the `experiment_name` parameter to `enzymatic de novo DNA synthesis of ACTCTGAT` to maintain the context of the overall experiment.
I will set the `file_ids` parameter to `['Protocol-18bd', 'Hypothesis-7908']`. `Protocol-18bd` is the ID of our current best procedure (6h, 98.00% yield), and `Hypothesis-7908` contains the advice to reduce the incubation time. This provides the agent with both the baseline procedure and the modification to apply.
I will set the `manuals` parameter to `['beads-manual', '3-ONH2-dnTP-manual']` to ensure any modifications are consistent with the known specifications of the reagents and materials.
I will set `pure_software` to `False` as this is a wet lab experiment.
I will set `retry` to `False` as this is a standard optimization step, not a recovery from a major failure.

args.experiment_name: enzymatic de novo DNA synthesis of ACTCTGAT
